issue.message: All com.android.support libraries must use the exact same version specification (mixing versions can lead to runtime crashes). Found versions 28.0.0, 26.1.0. Examples include `com.android.support:animated-vector-drawable:28.0.0` and `com.android.support:support-media-compat:26.1.0`
Not targeting the latest versions of Android; compatibility modes apply. Consider testing and updating this version. Consult the android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES javadoc for details.
Avoid passing `null` as the view root (needed to resolve layout parameters on the inflated layout's root element)
A newer version of com.android.support.constraint:constraint-layout than 1.1.3 is available: 2.0.4
A newer version of com.google.firebase:firebase-auth than 17.0.0 is available: 20.0.1
A newer version of com.google.firebase:firebase-core than 16.0.9 is available: 18.0.0
A newer version of com.google.firebase:firebase-database than 16.0.1 is available: 19.5.1
A newer version of com.google.firebase:firebase-firestore than 19.0.0 is available: 22.0.0
Should use "`sp`" instead of "`dp`" for text sizes

On SDK version 23 and up, your app data will be automatically backed up, and restored on app install. Your GCM regid will not work across restores, so you must ensure that it is excluded from the back-up set. Use the attribute `android:fullBackupContent` to specify an `@xml` resource which configures which files to backup. More info: https://developer.android.com/training/backup/autosyncapi.html
Possible overdraw: Root element paints background `@drawable/bac` with a theme that also paints a background (inferred theme is `@style/AppTheme`)
Possible overdraw: Root element paints background `@drawable/luncher` with a theme that also paints a background (inferred theme is `@style/AppTheme`)
Possible overdraw: Root element paints background `#e0e0e0` with a theme that also paints a background (inferred theme is `@style/AppTheme`)

The resource `R.string.project_id` appears to be unused
App is not indexable by Google Search; consider adding at least one Activity with an ACTION-VIEW intent filter. See issue explanation for more details.
The view name (`@+id/edEmail`) suggests this is an e-mail address, but it does not include '`textEmail`' in the `inputType`
